sabtah_2451.name: Sabtah
sabtah_2451.bio: Rest, the third son of Cush ([Gen. 10:7](/gen#Gen.10.7); [1 Chr. 1:9](/1chr#1Chr.1.9)).

sacar_2453.name: Sacar
sacar_2453.bio: A son of Obed-edom the Gittite, and a temple porter ([1 Chr. 26:4](/1chr#1Chr.26.4)).

sadoc_2454.name: Sadoc
sadoc_2454.bio: Just, mentioned in the genealogy of our Lord ([Matt. 1:14](/matt#Matt.1.14)).

salah_2455.name: Salah
salah_2455.bio: A shoot, a descendant of Arphaxed ([Luke 3:35](/luke#Luke.3.35), [36](/luke#Luke.3.36)); called also Shelah ([1 Chr. 1:18](/1chr#1Chr.1.18), [24](/1chr#1Chr.1.24)).

salathiel_2457.name: Salathiel
salathiel_2457.bio: Whom I asked of God, the son of Jeconiah ([Matt. 1:12](/matt#Matt.1.12); [1 Chr. 3:17](/1chr#1Chr.3.17)); also called the son of Neri ([Luke 3:27](/luke#Luke.3.27)).

salmon_2463.name: Salmon
salmon_2463.bio: Shady; or Zalmon (q.v.), a hill covered with dark forests, south of Shechem, from which Abimelech and his men gathered wood to burn that city ([Judg. 9:48](/judg#Judg.9.48)). In [Ps.

salome_2464.name: Salome
salome_2464.bio: The wife of Zebedee and mother of James and John ([Mat. 27:56](/matt#Matt.27.56)), and probably the sister of Mary, the mother of our Lord ([John 19:25](/john#John.19.25)). She sought for her sons places of honour in Christ’s kingdom ([Matt.

samgar-nebo_2466.name: Samgar-nebo
samgar-nebo_2466.bio: Be gracious, O Nebo! or a cup-bearer of Nebo, probably the title of Nergal-sharezer, one of the princes of Babylon ([Jer. 39:3](/jer#Jer.39.3)).

samson_2468.name: Samson
samson_2468.bio: Of the sun, the son of Manoah, born at Zorah. The narrative of his life is given in [Judg. 13](/judg#Judg.13)-16.

samuel_2469.name: Samuel
samuel_2469.bio: heard of God. The peculiar circumstances connected with his birth are recorded in 1�Samuel 1:20 . Hannah, one of the two wives of Elkanah, who came up to Shiloh to worship before the Lord, earnestly prayed to God that she might become the mother of a son.

sanballat_2470.name: Sanballat
sanballat_2470.bio: Held some place of authority in Samaria when Nehemiah went up to Jerusalem to rebuild its ruined walls. He vainly attempted to hinder this work ([Neh. 2:10](/neh#Neh.2.10), [19](/neh#Neh.2.19); 4:1-12; 6).

sapphira_2472.name: Sapphira
sapphira_2472.bio: beautiful, the wife of Ananias (q.v.). She was a partner in his guilt and also in his punishment ( Acts 5:1-11 ).

sarah_2473.name: Sarah
sarah_2473.bio: Princess, the wife and at the same time the half-sister of Abraham ([Gen. 11:29](/gen#Gen.11.29); [20:12](/gen#Gen.20.12)). This name was given to her at the time that it was announced to Abraham that she should be the mother of the promised child.

satan_2476.name: Satan
satan_2476.bio: adversary; accuser. When used as a proper name, the Hebrew word so rendered has the article "the adversary" ( Job 1:6-12 ; 2:1-7 ). In the New Testament it is used as interchangeable with Diabolos, or the devil, and is so used more than thirty times.

saul_2478.name: Saul
saul_2478.bio: The son of Kish (probably his only son, and a child of prayer, “asked for”), of the tribe of Benjamin, the first king of the Jewish nation. The singular providential circumstances connected with his election as king are recorded in [1 Sam. 8](/1sam#1Sam.8)-10.

sceva_2480.name: Sceva
sceva_2480.bio: an implement, a Jew, chief of the priests at Ephesus ( Acts 19:13-16 ); i.e., the head of one of the twenty-four courses of the house of Levi. He had seven sons, who "took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus," in imitation of Paul. They tried their method of exorcism on a fierce demoniac, and failed.

seba_2481.name: Seba
seba_2481.bio: One of the sons of Cush ([Gen. 10:7](/gen#Gen.10.7)).

secundus_2482.name: Secundus
secundus_2482.bio: second, a Christian of Thessalonica who accompanied Paul into Asia ( Acts 20:4 ).

segub_2483.name: Segub (native of Bethel)
segub_2483.bio: The youngest son of Hiel the Bethelite. His death is recorded in [1 Kings 16:34](/1kgs#1Kgs.16.34) (comp. [Josh.

seir_2485.name: Seir
seir_2485.bio: A Horite; one of the “dukes” of Edom ([Gen. 36:20-30](/gen#Gen.36.20)).

semei_2488.name: Semei
semei_2488.bio: Mentioned in the genealogy of our Lord ([Luke 3:26](/luke#Luke.3.26)).

sennacherib_2489.name: Sennacherib
sennacherib_2489.bio: Sin (the god) sends many brothers, son of Sargon, whom he succeeded on the throne of Assyria (B.C. 705), in the 23rd year of Hezekiah. “Like the Persian Xerxes, he was weak and vainglorious, cowardly under reverse, and cruel and boastful in success.” He first set himself to break up the powerful combination of princes who were in league against him.

seorim_2491.name: Seorim
seorim_2491.bio: Barley, the chief of the forth priestly course ([1 Chr. 24:8](/1chr#1Chr.24.8)).

serah_2492.name: Serah
serah_2492.bio: Abundance; princess, the daughter of Asher and grand-daughter of Jacob ([Gen. 46:17](/gen#Gen.46.17)); called also Sarah ([Num. 26:46](/num#Num.26.46); R.V., “Serah”).

seraiah_2498.name: Seraiah (Jeshua son of Azaniah)
seraiah_2498.bio: A priest of the days of Jehoiakim ([Neh. 12:1](/neh#Neh.12.1), [12](/neh#Neh.12.12)).

seraiah_2500.name: Seraiah (son of Neriah)
seraiah_2500.bio: The son of Neriah. When Zedekiah made a journey to Babylon to do homage to Nebuchadnezzar, Seraiah had charge of the royal gifts to be presented on that occasion. Jeremiah took advantage of the occasion, and sent with Seraiah a word of cheer to the exiles in Babylon, and an announcement of the doom in store for that guilty city.

sered_2501.name: Sered
sered_2501.bio: Fear, one of the sons of Zebulun ([Gen. 46:14](/gen#Gen.46.14)).

sergius_2502.name: Sergius
sergius_2502.bio: a "prudent man" (RSV, "man of understanding"), the deputy (RSV, "proconsul") of Cyprus ( Acts 13:6-13 ). He became a convert to Christianity under Paul, who visited this island on his first mission to the heathen. A remarkable memorial of this proconsul was recently (1887) discovered at Rome.

serug_2503.name: Serug
serug_2503.bio: Branch, the father of Nahor ([Gen. 11:20-23](/gen#Gen.11.20)); called Saruch in [Luke 3:35](/luke#Luke.3.35).

seth_2504.name: Seth
seth_2504.bio: Appointed; a substitute, the third son of Adam and Eve ([Gen. 4:25](/gen#Gen.4.25); [5:3](/gen#Gen.5.3)). His mother gave him this name, “for God,” said she, “hath appointed me [i.e., compensated me with] another seed instead of Abel, whom Cain slew.”

sethur_2505.name: Sethur
sethur_2505.bio: Hidden, one of the spies sent to search the Promised Land. He was of the tribe of Asher ([Num. 13:13](/num#Num.13.13)).

shaashgaz_2508.name: Shaashgaz
shaashgaz_2508.bio: Servant of the beautiful, a chief eunuch in the second house of the harem of king Ahasuerus ([Esther 2:14](/esth#Esth.2.14)).

shabbethai_2511.name: Shabbethai (A Levite mentioned in connection with Ez)

shadrach_1398.name: Shadrach
shadrach_1398.bio: Aku’s command, the Chaldean name given to Hananiah, one of the Hebrew youths whom Nebuchadnezzar carried captive to Babylon ([Dan. 1:6](/dan#Dan.1.6), [7](/dan#Dan.1.7); 3:12-30). He and his two companions refused to bow down before the image which Nebuchadnezzar had set up on the plains of Dura.

shallum_2514.name: Shallum (Israel)
shallum_2514.bio: The son of Jabesh, otherwise unknown. He “conspired against Zachariah, and smote him before the people, and slew him, and reigned in his stead” ([2 Kings 15:10](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.10)). He reigned only “a month of days in Samaria” (15:13, marg.).

shallum_2515.name: Shallum (son of Harhas)
shallum_2515.bio: Keeper of the temple vestments in the reign of Josiah ([2 Kings 22:14](/2kgs#2Kgs.22.14)).

shallum_2517.name: Shallum (King of Isreal)
shallum_2517.bio: One of the posterity of Judah ([1 Chr. 2:40](/1chr#1Chr.2.40), [41](/1chr#1Chr.2.41)).

shallum_2520.name: Shallum (gatekeeper)
shallum_2520.bio: A keeper of the gate in the reign of David ([1 Chr. 9:17](/1chr#1Chr.9.17)).

shallum_2524.name: Shallum (ruler of a district of Jerusalem)

shallum_2525.name: Shallum (Anathoth)
shallum_2525.bio: The uncle of the prophet Jeremiah ([Jer. 32:7](/jer#Jer.32.7)).

shalmaneser_2529.name: Shalmaneser
shalmaneser_2529.bio: An Assyrian king ([Hos. 10:14](/hos#Hos.10.14)), identified with Shalmaneser II. (Sayce) or IV.

shamer_2725.name: Shamer (son of Heber)
shamer_2725.bio: A man of Asher ([1 Chr. 7:32](/1chr#1Chr.7.32)); called also Shamer (34).

shamgar_2534.name: Shamgar
shamgar_2534.bio: The Philistines from the maritime plain had made incursions into the Hebrew upland for the purposes of plunder, when one of this name, the son of Anath, otherwise unknown, headed a rising for the purpose of freeing the land from this oppression. He repelled the invasion, slaying 600 men with an “ox goad” (q.v.). The goad was a formidable sharpointed instrument, sometimes ten feet long.

shamir_2536.name: Shamir
shamir_2536.bio: One of the sons of Michah ([1 Chr. 24:24](/1chr#1Chr.24.24)).

shammah_2539.name: Shammah (son of Agee)
shammah_2539.bio: One of David’s three mighty men ([2 Sam. 23:11](/2sam#2Sam.23.11), [12](/2sam#2Sam.23.12)).

shammah_2540.name: Shammah (one of David's mighty men)
shammah_2540.bio: One of David’s mighties ([2 Sam. 23:25](/2sam#2Sam.23.25)); called also Shammoth ([1 Chr. 11:27](/1chr#1Chr.11.27)) and Shamhuth (27:8).

shammah_2700.name: Shammah (the Not Chosen)
shammah_2700.bio: One of the sons of Jesse ([1 Sam. 16:9](/1sam#1Sam.16.9)). He is also called Shimeah ([2 Sam.

shammai_2544.name: Shammai (The son of Rekem and father of Maon)

shammua_2545.name: Shammua (Son of zaccur)
shammua_2545.bio: One of the spies sent out by Moses to search the land ([Num. 13:4](/num#Num.13.4)). He represented the tribe of Reuben.

shammua_2547.name: Shammua (Son of David who reigned in Jerusalem)
shammua_2547.bio: One of David’s sons by Bathsheba ([1 Chr. 3:5](/1chr#1Chr.3.5)); called also Shammua (14:4).

shaphan_2550.name: Shaphan (king of Judah)
shaphan_2550.bio: A coney, a scribe or secretary of king Josiah ([2 Kings 22:3-7](/2kgs#2Kgs.22.3)). He consulted Huldah concerning the newly-discovered copy of the law which was delivered to him by Hilkiah the priest (8-14). His grandson Gedaliah was governor of Judea (25:22).

shaphat_2552.name: Shaphat (son of Hori)
shaphat_2552.bio: One of the spies. He represented the tribe of Simeon ([Num. 13:5](/num#Num.13.5)).

shaphat_2555.name: Shaphat (father of Elisha and son of Adlai)

shaphat_2556.name: Shaphat (son of Adlai)
shaphat_2556.bio: One of David’s chief herdsmen ([1 Chr. 27:29](/1chr#1Chr.27.29)).

sharar_2558.name: Sharar
sharar_2558.bio: One of David’s heroes ([1 Chr. 11:35](/1chr#1Chr.11.35)); called also Sharar ([2 Sam. 23:33](/2sam#2Sam.23.33)).

sharezer_2559.name: Sharezer
sharezer_2559.bio: (god) protect the king!, a son of Sennacherib, king of Assyria. He and his brother Adrammelech murdered their father, and then fled into the land of Armenia ([2 Kings 19:37](/2kgs#2Kgs.19.37)).

shaul_2477.name: Shaul (Saul Of Tarsus. The Messenger)
shaul_2477.bio: A king of Edom ([Gen. 36:37](/gen#Gen.36.37), [38](/gen#Gen.36.38)); called Shaul in [1 Chr. 1:48](/1chr#1Chr.1.48).

shavsha_2493.name: Shavsha
shavsha_2493.bio: (“Seraiah,” [2 Sam. 8:17](/2sam#2Sam.8.17); “Shisha,” [1 Kings 4:3](/1kgs#1Kgs.4.3)), one of David’s secretaries ([1 Chr. 18:16](/1chr#1Chr.18.16)).

shealtiel_2456.name: Shealtiel
shealtiel_2456.bio: Asked for of God, father of Zerubbabel ([Ezra 3:2](/ezra#Ezra.3.2), [8](/ezra#Ezra.3.8); [Neh. 12:1](/neh#Neh.12.1)).

sheba_2567.name: Sheba (his brother name was Dedan)
sheba_2567.bio: Heb. shebha, the son of Raamah ([Gen. 10:7](/gen#Gen.10.7)), whose descendants settled with those of Dedan on the Persian Gulf.

sheba_2568.name: Sheba (the Semite)
sheba_2568.bio: Heb. id. A son of Joktan ([Gen.

sheba_2569.name: Sheba (his brother named Dedan)
sheba_2569.bio: Heb. id. A son of Jokshan, who was a son of Abraham by Keturah ([Gen.

sheba_2570.name: Sheba (Queen who questioned Solomon)
sheba_2570.bio: Heb. id. A “son of Bichri,” of the family of Becher, the son of Benjamin, and thus of the stem from which Saul was descended ([2 Sam.

shebaniah_2572.name: Shebaniah (Obed-Edom)
shebaniah_2572.bio: A Levite appointed to blow the trumpet before the ark of God ([1 Chr. 15:24](/1chr#1Chr.15.24)).

shebaniah_2573.name: Shebaniah (Levite appointed to blow the trumpet bef)

shebaniah_2574.name: Shebaniah (The Priest)
shebaniah_2574.bio: A priest who returned from the Captivity with Zerubbabel ([Neh. 12:3](/neh#Neh.12.3); marg., or Shebaniah).

shebna_2577.name: Shebna (son of Asaph)
shebna_2577.bio: Tender youth, “treasurer” over the house in the reign of Hezekiah, i.e., comptroller or governor of the palace. On account of his pride he was ejected from his office, and Eliakim was promoted to it ([Isa. 22:15-25](/isa#Isa.22.15)).

shecaniah_2581.name: Shecaniah (Also called Shekaniah. A leader of one o)
shecaniah_2581.bio: A priest to whom the tenth lot came forth when David divided the priests ([1 Chr. 24:11](/1chr#1Chr.24.11)).

shecaniah_2582.name: Shecaniah (A priest in the time of David)
shecaniah_2582.bio: One of the priests who were set “to give to their brethren by courses” of the daily portion ([2 Chr. 31:15](/2chr#2Chr.31.15)). Shechani’ah, id.

shechaniah_2583.name: Shechaniah (A priest in the reign of Hezekiah)
shechaniah_2583.bio: A priest whose sons are mentioned in [1 Chr. 3:21](/1chr#1Chr.3.21), [22](/1chr#1Chr.3.22).

shechaniah_2584.name: Shechaniah (The tenth in order of the priests who we)

shechaniah_2586.name: Shechaniah (son of Jehiel)
shechaniah_2586.bio: The father of Shemaiah, who repaired the wall of Jerusalem ([Neh. 3:29](/neh#Neh.3.29)).

shechem_2588.name: Shechem (a Canaanite city mentioned in the Amarna)
shechem_2588.bio: shoulder. The son of Hamor the Hivite ( Genesis 33:19 ; 34 ).

shelemiah_2597.name: Shelemiah (God is my perfection; my happiness; my p)

shelemiah_2600.name: Shelemiah (father of Jehukal)
shelemiah_2600.bio: Father of one of those who accused Jeremiah to Zedekiah ([Jer. 37:3](/jer#Jer.37.3); [38:1](/jer#Jer.38.1)).

shelemiah_2601.name: Shelemiah (father of Irijah)
shelemiah_2601.bio: Father of a captain of the ward ([Jer. 37:13](/jer#Jer.37.13)).

shem_2613.name: Shem
shem_2613.bio: A name; renown, the first mentioned of the sons of Noah ([Gen. 5:32](/gen#Gen.5.32); [6:10](/gen#Gen.6.10)). He was probably the eldest of Noah’s sons.

shema_2616.name: Shema (who were heads of families of those livi)

shema_2617.name: Shema (One of the Leaders)
shema_2617.bio: One who stood by Ezra when he read the law ([Neh. 8:4](/neh#Neh.8.4)).

shemaah_2618.name: Shemaah
shemaah_2618.bio: Rumour, a Benjamite whose sons “came to David to Ziklag” ([1 Chr. 12:3](/1chr#1Chr.12.3)).

shemaiah_2619.name: Shemaiah (Paul)
shemaiah_2619.bio: A prophet in the reign of Rehoboam ([1 Kings 12:22-24](/1kgs#1Kgs.12.22)).

shemaiah_2621.name: Shemaiah (a prophet in the reign of Rehoboam.)

shemaiah_2625.name: Shemaiah (descendants of Aaron)
shemaiah_2625.bio: A Levite in the time of David, who with 200 of his brethren took part in the bringing up of the ark from Obed-edom to Hebron ([1 Chr. 15:8](/1chr#1Chr.15.8)).

shemaiah_2627.name: Shemaiah (The eldest son of Obed-edom the Gittite.)
shemaiah_2627.bio: The eldest son of Obed-edom ([1 Chr. 26:4-8](/1chr#1Chr.26.4)).

shemaiah_2628.name: Shemaiah (The Lord established the kingdom under h)
shemaiah_2628.bio: One of the Levites whom Jehoshaphat appointed to teach the law ([2 Chr. 17:8](/2chr#2Chr.17.8)).

shemaiah_2630.name: Shemaiah (of Jerusalem)
shemaiah_2630.bio: A Levite appointed to “distribute the oblations of the Lord” ([2 Chr. 31:15](/2chr#2Chr.31.15)).

shemaiah_2631.name: Shemaiah (one of the chiefs of the Levites)

shemaiah_2635.name: Shemaiah (A son of Shecaniah who descended from ki)

shemaiah_2636.name: Shemaiah (he was a prophet in the reign of Rehoboa)

shemaiah_2637.name: Shemaiah (son of Delaiah)
shemaiah_2637.bio: A false prophet who hindered the rebuilding of Jerusalem ([Neh. 6:10](/neh#Neh.6.10)).

shemaiah_2638.name: Shemaiah (that hears or obeys the Lord.  a name wh)

shemaiah_2642.name: Shemaiah (father of Urijah)
shemaiah_2642.bio: The father of Urijah the prophet ([Jer. 26:20](/jer#Jer.26.20)).

shemaiah_2643.name: Shemaiah (of Nehelam)
shemaiah_2643.bio: A false prophet who opposed Jeremiah ([Jer. 29:24-32](/jer#Jer.29.24)).

shemaiah_2644.name: Shemaiah (father of Urijah)
shemaiah_2644.bio: The father of a prince in the reign of Jehoiakim ([Jer. 36:12](/jer#Jer.36.12)).

shemariah_2645.name: Shemariah (One who joined David at Ziklag)
shemariah_2645.bio: One who joined David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:5](/1chr#1Chr.12.5)).

shemeber_2648.name: Shemeber
shemeber_2648.bio: Soaring on high, the king of Zeboiim, who joined with the other kings in casting off the yoke of Chedorlaomer. After having been reconquered by him, he was rescued by Abraham ([Gen. 14:2](/gen#Gen.14.2)).

shemiramoth_2651.name: Shemiramoth (Jaaziel)
shemiramoth_2651.bio: A Levite in David’s time ([1 Chr. 15:18](/1chr#1Chr.15.18), [20](/1chr#1Chr.15.20)).

shemiramoth_2652.name: Shemiramoth (Levite)
shemiramoth_2652.bio: A Levite in the reign of Jehoshaphat ([2 Chr. 17:8](/2chr#2Chr.17.8)).

shemuel_2653.name: Shemuel (Appointed by God)
shemuel_2653.bio: The son of Ammihud. He represented Simeon in the division of the land ([Num. 34:20](/num#Num.34.20)).

shemuel_2654.name: Shemuel (sons of Tola)
shemuel_2654.bio: A prince of the tribe of Issachar ([1 Chr. 7:2](/1chr#1Chr.7.2)).

shephatiah_2657.name: Shephatiah (A Benjamite who joined David at Ziklag ()

shephatiah_2658.name: Shephatiah (son of Kish)
shephatiah_2658.bio: A Benjamite who joined David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:5](/1chr#1Chr.12.5)).

shephatiah_2659.name: Shephatiah ((the son of Maachah)
shephatiah_2659.bio: A Simeonite prince in David’s time ([1 Chr. 27:16](/1chr#1Chr.27.16)).

shephatiah_2664.name: Shephatiah (son of Mattan)
shephatiah_2664.bio: One of the princes who urged the putting of Jeremiah to death ([Jer. 38:1-4](/jer#Jer.38.1)).

sheresh_2669.name: Sheresh
sheresh_2669.bio: Root, a descendant of Manasseh ([1 Chr. 7:16](/1chr#1Chr.7.16)).

sherezer_2670.name: Sherezer
sherezer_2670.bio: One of the messengers whom the children of the Captivity sent to Jerusalem “to pray for them before the Lord” ([Zech. 7:2](/zech#Zech.7.2)).

shethar_2673.name: Shethar
shethar_2673.bio: A star, a prince at the court of Ahasuerus ([Esther 1:14](/esth#Esth.1.14)).

shethar-boznai_2674.name: Shethar-boznai
shethar-boznai_2674.bio: Star of splendour, a Persian officer who vainly attempted to hinder the rebuilding of the temple ([Ezra 5:3](/ezra#Ezra.5.3), [6](/ezra#Ezra.5.6); 6:6, 13).

shimea_2680.name: Shimea (the Levite)
shimea_2680.bio: A Levite of the family of Merari ([1 Chr. 6:30](/1chr#1Chr.6.30)).

shimea_2681.name: Shimea (Grandfather of Asaph)
shimea_2681.bio: Another Levite of the family of Gershon ([1 Chr. 6:39](/1chr#1Chr.6.39)).

shimeah_2682.name: Shimeah
shimeah_2682.bio: A Benjamite, a descendant of Gibeon ([1 Chr. 8:32](/1chr#1Chr.8.32)); called also Shimeam (9:38).

shimei_691.name: Shimei (father of Zimmah)
shimei_691.bio: A Levite of the family of Gershon ([1 Chr. 6:42](/1chr#1Chr.6.42)).

shimei_2684.name: Shimei (A son of Gershon)
shimei_2684.bio: A Benjamite of the house of Saul, who stoned and cursed David when he reached Bahurim in his flight from Jerusalem on the occasion of the rebellion of Absalom ([2 Sam. 16:5-13](/2sam#2Sam.16.5)). After the defeat of Absalom he “came cringing to the king, humbly suing for pardon, bringing with him a thousand of his Benjamite tribesmen, and representing that he was heartily sorry for his crime, and had hurried the first of all the house of Israel to offer homage to the king” (19:16-23).

shimei_2685.name: Shimei (son of Elah)
shimei_2685.bio: One of David’s mighty men who refused to acknowledge Adonijah as David’s successor ([1 Kings 1:8](/1kgs#1Kgs.1.8)). He is probably the same person who is called elsewhere (4:18) “the son of Elah.”

shimei_2686.name: Shimei (Zerubbabel)
shimei_2686.bio: A son of Pedaiah, the brother of Zerubbabel ([1 Chr. 3:19](/1chr#1Chr.3.19)).

shimei_2690.name: Shimei (second son of Gershon)
shimei_2690.bio: A Ramathite who was “over the vineyards” of David ([1 Chr. 27:27](/1chr#1Chr.27.27)).

shimei_2691.name: Shimei (son of Heman)
shimei_2691.bio: One of the sons of Heman, who assisted in the purification of the temple ([2 Chr. 29:14](/2chr#2Chr.29.14)).

shimei_2694.name: Shimei (there are multiple characters in the Bib)

shimri_2704.name: Shimri (a village and municipality in the Astara)
shimri_2704.bio: The father of one of the “valiant men” of David’s armies ([1 Chr. 11:45](/1chr#1Chr.11.45)).

shimri_2705.name: Shimri (descendant of Elizaphan)
shimri_2705.bio: Assisted at the purification of the temple in the time of Hezekiah ([2 Chr. 29:13](/2chr#2Chr.29.13)).

shimrith_2724.name: Shimrith
shimrith_2724.bio: The mother of Jehozabad, who murdered Joash ([2 Kings 12:21](/2kgs#2Kgs.12.21)); called also Shimrith, a Moabitess ([2 Chr. 24:26](/2chr#2Chr.24.26)).

shimron_2706.name: Shimron
shimron_2706.bio: Watchman, the fourth son of Issachar ([Gen. 46:13](/gen#Gen.46.13); [1 Chr. 7:1](/1chr#1Chr.7.1); R.V., correctly, “Shimron”).

shimshai_2707.name: Shimshai
shimshai_2707.bio: The shining one, or sunny, the secretary of Rehum the chancellor, who took part in opposing the rebuilding of the temple after the Captivity ([Ezra 4:8](/ezra#Ezra.4.8), [9](/ezra#Ezra.4.9), [17](/ezra#Ezra.4.17)-23).

shinab_2708.name: Shinab
shinab_2708.bio: Cooling, the king of Adamah, in the valley of Siddim, who with his confederates was conquered by Chedorlaomer ([Gen. 14:2](/gen#Gen.14.2)).

shiphrah_2710.name: Shiphrah
shiphrah_2710.bio: Beauty, one of the Egyptian midwives ([Ex. 1:15](/exod#Exod.1.15)).

shiphtan_2711.name: Shiphtan
shiphtan_2711.bio: Judicial, an Ephraimite prince at the time of the division of Canaan ([Num. 34:24](/num#Num.34.24)).

shishak_2712.name: Shishak
shishak_2712.bio: '=Sheshonk I., king of Egypt. His reign was one of great national success, and a record of his wars and conquests adorns the portico of what are called the “Bubastite kings” at Karnak, the ancient Thebes. Among these conquests is a record of that of Judea.

shobab_2715.name: Shobab (Hiram king)
shobab_2715.bio: One of David’s sons by Bathseheba ([2 Sam. 5:14](/2sam#2Sam.5.14)).

shobab_2716.name: Shobab (Caleb Son of Hezron)
shobab_2716.bio: One of the sons of Caleb ([1 Chr. 2:18](/1chr#1Chr.2.18)), the son of Hezron.

shobach_2717.name: Shobach
shobach_2717.bio: Poured out, the “captain of the host of Hadarezer” when he mustered his vassals and tributaries from beyond “the river Euphrates” ([2 Sam. 10:15-18](/2sam#2Sam.10.15)); called also Shophach ([1 Chr. 19:16](/1chr#1Chr.19.16)).

shobal_2719.name: Shobal (Seir the Horite)
shobal_2719.bio: The second son of Seir the Horite; one of the Horite “dukes” ([Gen. 36:20](/gen#Gen.36.20)).

shobal_2720.name: Shobal (Second son of Seir the Horite)
shobal_2720.bio: One of the sons of Caleb, and a descendant of Hur ([1 Chr. 2:50](/1chr#1Chr.2.50), [52](/1chr#1Chr.2.52); [4:1](/1chr#1Chr.4.1), [2](/1chr#1Chr.4.2)).

shobi_2722.name: Shobi
shobi_2722.bio: Captor, son of Nahash of Rabbah, the Ammonite. He showed kindness to David when he fled from Jerusalem to Mahanaim ([2 Sam. 17:27](/2sam#2Sam.17.27)).

shua_2726.name: Shua
shua_2726.bio: A daughter of Heber the Asherite ([1 Chr. 7:32](/1chr#1Chr.7.32)).

shuah_2727.name: Shuah (The sons of Jokshan)
shuah_2727.bio: One of Abraham’s sons by Keturah ([Gen. 25:2](/gen#Gen.25.2); Chr. 1:32).

shuah_2728.name: Shuah (Founder of Sucha)
shuah_2728.bio: A Canaanite whose daughter was married to Judah ([1 Chr. 2:3](/1chr#1Chr.2.3)).

shubael_2579.name: Shubael (seat of God)
shubael_2579.bio: One of the descendants of Gershom, who had charge of the temple treasures in the time of David ([1 Chr. 23:16](/1chr#1Chr.23.16); [26:24](/1chr#1Chr.26.24)).

shubael_2580.name: Shubael (Of Heman)
shubael_2580.bio: One of the sons of Heman; one of those whose duty it was to “lift up the horn” in the temple service ([1 Chr. 25:4](/1chr#1Chr.25.4), [5](/1chr#1Chr.25.5)); called also Shubael (ver. 20).

sibbechai_2737.name: Sibbechai
sibbechai_2737.bio: The Lord sustains, one of David’s heroes ([1 Chr. 11:29](/1chr#1Chr.11.29)), general of the eighth division of the army (27:11). He slew the giant Saph in the battle of Gob ([2 Sam.

sihon_2739.name: Sihon
sihon_2739.bio: Striking down. The whole country on the east of Jordan, from the Arnon to the Jabbok, was possessed by the Amorites, whose king, Sihon, refused to permit the Israelites to pass through his territory, and put his army in array against them. The Israelites went forth against him to battle, and gained a complete victory.

silas_2740.name: Silas
silas_2740.bio: wood, a prominent member of the church at Jerusalem; also called Silvanus. He and Judas, surnamed Barsabas, were chosen by the church there to accompany Paul and Barnabas on their return to Antioch from the council of the apostles and elders ( Acts 15:22 ), as bearers of the decree adopted by the council. He assisted Paul there in his evangelistic labours, and was also chosen by him to be his companion on his second missionary tour ( Acts 16:19-24 ).

simeon_2741.name: Simeon (the God-receiver)
simeon_2741.bio: The second son of Jacob by Leah ([Gen. 29:33](/gen#Gen.29.33)). He was associated with Levi in the terrible act of vengeance against Hamor and the Shechemites (34:25, 26).

simeon_2743.name: Simeon (associated with Levi)
simeon_2743.bio: One of the ancestors of Joseph ([Luke 3:30](/luke#Luke.3.30)).

simeon_2744.name: Simeon (The Prophet)
simeon_2744.bio: hearing. Surnamed Niger, i.e., "black," perhaps from his dark complexion, a teacher of some distinction in the church of Antioch ( Acts 13:1-3 ). It has been supposed that this was the Simon of Cyrene who bore Christ's cross.

simon_2746.name: Simon (the Zealot)
simon_2746.bio: the abbreviated form of Simeon. One of the twelve apostles, called the Canaanite ( Matthew 10:4 ; Mark 3:18 ). This word "Canaanite" does not mean a native of Canaan, but is derived from the Syriac word Kanean or Kaneniah, which was the name of a Jewish sect.

simon_2747.name: Simon (A Leper)
simon_2747.bio: One of the brothers of our Lord ([Matt. 13:55](/matt#Matt.13.55); [Mark 6:3](/mark#Mark.6.3)).

simon_2748.name: Simon (leper)
simon_2748.bio: A leper of Bethany, in whose house Mary anointed our Lord’s head with ointment “as he sat at meat” ([Matt. 26:6-13](/matt#Matt.26.6); [Mark 14:3-9](/mark#Mark.14.3)).

simon_2749.name: Simon (from Cyrene)
simon_2749.bio: A Jew of Cyrene, in North Africa, then a province of Libya. A hundred thousand Jews from Palestine had been settled in this province by Ptolemy Soter (B.C. 323-285), where by this time they had greatly increased in number.

simon_2752.name: Simon (son of Jonah)
simon_2752.bio: A sorcerer of great repute for his magical arts among the Samaritans ( Acts 8:9-11 ). He afterwards became a professed convert to the faith under the preaching of Philip the deacon and evangelist (12,13). His profession was, however, soon found to be hollow.

simon_2753.name: Simon (the Tanner)
simon_2753.bio: A Christian at Joppa, a tanner by trade, with whom Peter on one occasion lodged ( Acts 9:43 ).

simri_2754.name: Simri
simri_2754.bio: Watchman, a Levite of the family of Merari ([1 Chr. 26:10](/1chr#1Chr.26.10)).

sinite_2755.name: Sinite
sinite_2755.bio: An inhabitant of Sin, near Arka ([Gen. 10:17](/gen#Gen.10.17); [1 Chr. 1:15](/1chr#1Chr.1.15)).

sippai_2471.name: Sippai
sippai_2471.bio: Extension, the son of the giant whom Sibbechai slew ([2 Sam. 21:18](/2sam#2Sam.21.18)); called also Sippai ([1 Chr. 20:4](/1chr#1Chr.20.4)).

sisera_2757.name: Sisera (commander of the Canaanite army of King)
sisera_2757.bio: The captain of Jabin’s army ([Judg. 4:2](/judg#Judg.4.2)), which was routed and destroyed by the army of Barak on the plain of Esdraelon. After all was lost he fled to the settlement of Heber the Kenite in the plain of Zaanaim.

sisera_2758.name: Sisera (captivity of the exiles)
sisera_2758.bio: The ancestor of some of the Nethinim who returned with Zerubbabel ([Ezra 2:53](/ezra#Ezra.2.53); [Neh. 7:55](/neh#Neh.7.55)).

so_2760.name: So
so_2760.bio: (Nubian, Sabako), an Ethiopian king who brought Egypt under his sway. He was bribed by Hoshea to help him against the Assyrian monarch Shalmaneser ([2 Kings 17:4](/2kgs#2Kgs.17.4)). This was a return to the policy that had been successful in the reign of Jeroboam I.

solomon_2762.name: Solomon
solomon_2762.bio: peaceful, (Heb. Shelomoh), David's second son by Bathsheba, i.e., the first after their legal marriage ( 2�Samuel 12 ). He was probably born about B.C.

sopater_2770.name: Sopater
sopater_2770.bio: the father who saves, probably the same as Sosipater, a kinsman of Paul ( Romans 16:21 ), a Christian of the city of Berea who accompanied Paul into Asia ( Acts 20:4-6 ).

sosthenes_2772.name: Sosthenes
sosthenes_2772.bio: safe in strength, the chief ruler of the synagogue at Corinth, who was seized and beaten by the mob in the presence of Gallio, the Roman governor, when he refused to proceed against Paul at the instigation of the Jews ( Acts 18:12-17 ). The motives of this assault against Sosthenes are not recorded, nor is it mentioned whether it was made by Greeks or Romans. Some identify him, but without sufficient grounds, with one whom Paul calls "Sosthenes our brother," a convert to the faith ( 1�Corinthians 1:1 ).

stachys_2774.name: Stachys
stachys_2774.bio: Spike; an ear of corn, a convert at Rome whom Paul salutes ([Rom. 16:9](/rom#Rom.16.9)).

stephanas_2801.name: Stephanas
stephanas_2801.bio: Crown, a member of the church at Corinth, whose family were among those the apostle had baptized ([1 Cor. 1:16](/1cor#1Cor.1.16); [16:15](/1cor#1Cor.16.15), [17](/1cor#1Cor.16.17)). He has been supposed by some to have been the “jailer of Philippi” (comp.

stephen_2802.name: Stephen
stephen_2802.bio: one of the seven deacons, who became a preacher of the gospel. He was the first Christian martyr. His personal character and history are recorded in Acts 6 .

susanna_2804.name: Susanna
susanna_2804.bio: Lily, with other pious women, ministered to Jesus ([Luke 8:3](/luke#Luke.8.3)).

susi_2805.name: Susi
susi_2805.bio: The father of Gaddi, who was one of the twelve spies ([Num. 13:11](/num#Num.13.11)).

syntyche_2806.name: Syntyche
syntyche_2806.bio: Fortunate; affable, a female member of the church at Philippi, whom Paul beseeches to be of one mind with Euodias ([Phil. 4:2](/phil#Phil.4.2), [3](/phil#Phil.4.3)).
